intro: Psychotria lophocarpa, commonly known as the red-eyed beauty, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to tropical regions of South America. It is a shrub characterized by its striking red flowers with yellow centers, which are highly attractive to pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. The plant produces small, dark purple berries that contain the seeds, which are dispersed by animals. Psychotria lophocarpa is often found in moist, shaded forest understories, thriving in humid and warm climates. Its foliage is typically dark green and glossy, contributing to its ornamental value in botanical gardens and landscapes.
